sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the Service Academies  District of Columbia Equality Act, which would give the District of  Columbia the same number of appointments and nominations to the U.S.
title: Introduction of the Service Academies District of Columbia Equality Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the Pittman-Robertson  Wildlife Restoration Act and Dingell-Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act  District of Columbia Equality Act.
title: Introduction of the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act and Dingell-Johnson Sport Fish Restoration Act District of Columbia Equality Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  Electronic Transmittal of Legislation Act, which would permit the Chair  of the Council of the District of Columbia to transmit legislation to  Congress in the form of the Chair's choosing, including electronic  form.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia Electronic Transmittal of Legislation Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  Government Title Equality Act.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia Government Title Equality Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  Non-Discrimination Home Rule Act of 2025, which would end the  applicability of the Religious Freedom Restoration Act of 1993 (RFRA)  to the District of Columbia government.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia Non-Discrimination Home Rule Act of 2025

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  Courts and Public Defender Service Employment Non-Discrimination Act,  which would provide for coverage of employees of the local D.C.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia Courts and Public Defender Service Employment Non-Discrimination Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  Board of Zoning Adjustment Home Rule Act.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia Board of Zoning Adjustment Home Rule Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the Universal  Prekindergarten and Early Childhood Education Act of 2025, which would  establish and expand prekindergarten programs in public and public  charter schools for three- and four-year-olds.
title: Introduction of the Universal Prekindergarten and Early Childhood Education Act of 2025

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the Federal Government  Advertising Equity Accountability Act, which would require all federal  agencies to include in their annual budget requests to Congress the  amount they spend on advertising contracts with small disadvantaged  businesses (SDBs) and businesses owned by minorities and women.
title: Introduction of the Federal Government Advertising Equity Accountability Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the Equal Treatment of  the District of Columbia Under the Rural Health Transformation Program  Act of 2025, which would make the District of Columbia eligible for  funding under the Rural Health Transformation Program (Program).
title: Introduction of the Equal Treatment of the District of Columbia Under the Rural Health Transformation Program Act of 2025

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce a bill that would require  the Directors of two federal agencies, the Court Services and Offender  Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia (CSOSA) and the  District of Columbia Pretrial Services Agency (PSA), to reside in the  District of Columbia during their terms.
title: Introduction of the Requirement of the Director of the Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia and the Director of the District of Columbia Pretrial Services Agency to Reside in the District of Columbia

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  National Guard Home Rule Act, which would give the mayor of the  District of Columbia control over the D.C.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia National Guard Home Rule Act

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce a bill that would permit  commercial filmmaking and photography throughout the grounds of the  U.S.
title: Introduction of A Bill to Permit Commercial Filmmaking and Photography on the Grounds of the U.S. Capitol

sentence: Speaker, today, I introduce the District of Columbia  National Guard Commanding General Residency Act, which would require  the Commanding General of the District of Columbia National Guard to  reside in D.C.
title: Introduction of the District of Columbia National Guard Commanding General Residency Act
